teststorydesc: The IIS performs a search for James Smith and finds too many matches based on the sending system's query (e.g., EHR-S). The IIS returns a response message indicating no person found (too many matches) to the querying system. It is expected that the requesting system (e.g., EHR-S) process the response message and display some indication to the end user that the person was not found (too many matches).
preCondition: A query is made to the IIS. Person may have a record in the IIS, however the IIS is unable narrow the search results to a single match (multiple matches exist).
postCondition: The clinician is provided some indication that too many matches were found.
testObjectives: Test the capability of the EHR-S to process a response message that returns no persons found (too many matches) and to provide an indication to the end user.
evaluationCriteria: Juror Document. Clinician is notified that too many matches were found.
